de.systemagmbh.common.util
Interface ISysMail

All Known Implementing Classes:
CSysMail
Deprecated. As of release 2.5, replaced by de.systemagmbh.tools.io.mail.ISysMailSender

public interface ISysMail

Provide an easy to use interface to a Mailing System. Usage:

  
 PrintStream stream = ISysMail.startLetter(...);
 ...
 stream.println(...);
 ...
 ISysMail.finishLetter();

Version:
$Date: 2005/08/18 10:30:47 $
Author:
R. Wilke, H. Helmstreit

Method Detail

startLetter

public PrintStream startLetter(String sender,
                               String recipient,
                               String subject)
                        throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Start a Letter. You may write the contents of your mail to the returned printstream.

Parameters:
sender - The mailbox of the Sender e.g. "bill.gates@microsoft.com"
recipient - The mailbox of the receiver, an absolute address A character string (address) which identifies a user to whom mail is to be sent. Mailbox normally consists of the host and user specifications. The standard mailbox naming convention is defined to be "user@domain". Additionally, the "container" in which mail is stored. On unix systems the user name (without domain) may be entered here.
subject - The subject of the e-mail
Returns:
a Printstream to write your letter.
Throws:
IOException

finishLetter

public void finishLetter()
                  throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Finish a Letter. The mail written to the printstream gets mailed.

Returns:
true, on success, false otherwise.
Throws:
IOException

issueCommand

public void issueCommand(String cmd,
                         int expect)
                  throws IOException
Deprecated. 
This is a way to forard a server command. It is somewhat depending on the protocol and used by the underlying Stream. You usually will not have to call it when working with an ISysMail.

Parameters:
cmd - The server command
expect - The expected server reply value.
Throws:
IOException
